positive_comments: This is also a very good module. The reporting aspect is one that is really important and one that every executive should have a good grasp on as this will become more and more critical and comprehensive as we move forward.
improvement_opportunities: I think there are a few opportunities here. One would be to have another part about reporting and go into them a little deeper with more specific information about how they differ. The second would be to have the readings be longer. I personally feel like the readings are a really valuable aspect of the course and one that provides a lot of value. I think it's an opportunity to really engage the course taker and provide details that are hard to include with the speakers. Lastly, there's another part about Supply Chains here. I think it would be beneficial to have all of them together in one Module rather than spaced out within a few.

positive_comments: I think the course ends well. It has some new information but also some summary aspects as well.
improvement_opportunities: I do have similar feedback here in that the readings are pretty short. I would also like to see more summary information that ties the modules together. Executives like to see how all the items are related in a more holistic nature. You could touch on how companies that are leading in ESG also lead in profitability and how the former brings in more consumers and customers. The other opportunity is that the last video says you've reached the end of the course and then there are readings after. That video should really be the last thing in my opinion.

positive_comments: I particularly liked the readings in this module. They were very informative, in-depth and all what I think is a good length for the course.  The presenter also outlines the material well.
improvement_opportunities: I think this would be a good place to put the The Role of AI in Logistics and Supply Chain from Module 2. I think it fits better here than in that Module. That would really be my only feedback here.

positive_comments: This is an important module for business executives to understand, especially greenwashing.  This module also reviews two things I've never heard of before. The Triple Bottom Line and CSR. This is important as a framework for executives to comprehend and hopefully move more organizations from just profit-seeking entities.
improvement_opportunities: Although talked about a little in the Innovations Shaping a Greener Future, I think their should be more about EV's. Automotive contributes a lot to climate change and, as an industry, has lots of opportunities to discuss in terms of sustainability. Mining, supply chain and logistics, manufacturing, data and emissions. I think EVs should have their own reading because they encompass every aspect of business from the ground to the consumer.

positive_comments: Module 3, in my opinion, is the best one of the 8. I think this does an excellent job on each one of the videos and the accompanying readings are all very interesting. I think this is all very thought out and well-presented.
improvement_opportunities: If I had to give any opportunity it may be the assignments. I'm not sure that all those who take the course will have enough understanding of model development and testing within AI to provide meaningful answers.  They certainly may but if so I wouldn't have any other opportunities for improvement.

positive_comments: I really liked this module as well. I think it provides a good foundation for understanding important topics within sustainability, especially the part with the EPA, assuming the course is mostly taken by US citizens. It also looks at a wider range of information within sustainability.
improvement_opportunities: Compared to the other modules, the readings are all rather short, especially the Sectoral Solution to Climate Change, which is really only one page. That topic, raising the global temperature by 1.5 degrees and its effects, is really important. This should be discussed in more detail because I think many US citizens don't understand what this really means and how it will affect them both personally or how it may affect their business, supply chain, logistics, and many other things. I think the reading here should be an 8-9 page article.

positive_comments: I think this section does an excellent job of introducing the topics of Sustainability and AI. It also provides a few examples that illustrate how companies are using AI today.  Additionally I think all the readings provide good overviews and examples of each set of topics.
improvement_opportunities: For this section, I don't really have many suggestions. Perhaps the worksheets could be a little more detailed and aligned with each section.

positive_comments: I think this section is well done. The topics are a little deep, as AI is more complicated than Sustainability as a general statement. However, the topics are good ones and set up the person taking the course well for the coming sections.
improvement_opportunities: My feedback here is the individual sections are out of order. For example, The Role of AI in Logistics and Supply Chain is before The History and Evolution of AI. The former should be towards the end. After The History should be The Evolution of AI From Inception to Present. This could also be combined with the The History because they are both basically the same topic. I would have Decoding the next section followed by Key Principles, Strategic Planning, Evalutating AI solutions, The last the Role of AI in Logistics.
